intro: Pentacalia sonsonensis, commonly known as the Sonsonense Pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
